listing.description: A superb detached family house with self contained annexe in a secluded valley setting well away from traffic at popular Paganhill with grounds of nearly two acres with planning permission to build two detached houses (S.15/1610/ful)Main DescriptionA superb detached family house with self contained annexe in a secluded valley setting well away from traffic at popular Paganhill with grounds of nearly two acres with planning permission to build two detached houses (S.15/1610/ful)A well presented individual detached family house situated in a quiet secluded position a couple of miles west of Stroud centre. This location allows for easy access to local amenities and several well regarded schools, with country and canal side walks within easy reach. The property is built using traditional methods under a pitched roof and has clearly been the subject of comprehensive improvement, with flexible accommodation arranged over two floors.An entrance hall, cloakroom/W.C, 26’ sitting room with fireplace, dining room, lovely 20’ kitchen/family room with hand made units, utility room and boot room are found on the ground floor. The first floor hosts a landing, master bedroom with en suite bathroom, family bathroom and four further double bedrooms. A self contained annexe is situated above the garage and comprises an open plan living space with kitchen area, two bedrooms and a bathroom.OutsideA private drive and bridge leads over the brook into the grounds. These levels gardens are quite spectacular and extend to almost two acres, with the house in the middle of the grounds. Large level lawns stretching out from the front of the property. This area is beautifully planted, with mature specimen trees and a variety of shrubs and planted borders and a paved sitting area with a pergola over by the house. The parking area is to the front of the house and there is space here to park several vehicles and still turn, with an integral double garage on the right hand side of the house. The drive leads around to the rear of the property and another level hard standing area and a detached garage/workshop with wood store. The gardens then extend beyond this area, running down to the brook and sloping up at the back of the plot. The current owners have obtained planning permission to build two detached houses here (S.15/1610/ful) and prospective developers may look to apply for an amendment to this permission to build more than just two houses.LocationStroud town centre is only a short drive away for a wider range of shops and amenities, state, grammar and private schools, a leisure and sports centre, and a main line railway station, with inter city services travelling to London (Paddington). Cirencester (11 miles), Cheltenham (14 miles) and Swindon (26 miles), are all within comfortable driving distance. Junction 13, M5 motorway is approximately 8 miles distant.

listing.letting_fees:
Transparency for tenants

Once you've found the perfect property and your offer has been accepted, we'll start preparing the tenancy agreement and organising the logistics for your 'move-in' day. The tenancy charges may vary, depending on the agreement we have with the landlord, so it's best to ask the Marsh & Parsons office dealing with your offer for a full break down of costs.

That said, we don't want you to have any unwelcome surprises when it comes to signing the contract, so here's a list of what you can typically expect to pay:

Pre-Tenancy All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)

Tenancy Agreement / Admin Fee £270
Referencing Fee £30 per reference (including references for any proposed Guarantor)
Check-in Fee £130.80
Deposit Typically six weeks rent
Pet Deposit Returnable additional security deposit, equivalent to two weeks' rent

During your tenancy (if required) All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)
Renewal Document Fee £72
Change of Occupancy £120
Future Landlord Reference Fee £36

For more information regarding the lettings process, please visit the Lettings Advice for Tenants page.


Fees explained


Tenancy Agreement/Admin Fee - Provision of an expertly written tenancy agreement, brokering agreed amendments between landlord and tenant, and arrangement for completion and signature of the agreement by both parties, and registering your deposit with the Tenancy Deposit Scheme. Your deposit is typically six weeks rent.

Referencing Fee - The cost of referencing includes checking your credit status, previous employer, current or past landlords, and taking into account any other information to help assess the affordability of your tenancy application.

Check-in Fee - The cost of arranging for a clerk to meet you and agree the current inventory of the property at the start of your tenancy. The cost of the check-out at the end of the tenancy is met by the landlord.

Pet Deposit (Returnable) - To cover the added risk of property damage. This will be protected with your security deposit and may be returned at the end of the tenancy.

Renewal Document Fee - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Change of Occupancy - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Future Landlord Reference Fee - Collating information and preparing a reference for a future landlord or letting agent.
listing.description: Desirably arranged over the first floor of this imposing and sought-after red-brick building, this tremendous three-bedroom property offers generous accommodation throughout as well as a superb Westminster/Millbank location and views over a small and peaceful park. Entering into the wide hallway, the reception room is immediately on the right hand side and is spacious as well as tremendously light and bright with three windows across, looking out over the park. The kitchen is modern and fully-fitted as well as being generous in size as well as bright. The master bedroom is large with plenty of space for storage and the second bedroom once more benefitting from sizeable dimensions and in-built storage. Currently, the third bedroom is used as a dining room with a large dining table but will comfortably accommodate a double bed. The apartment boasts two modern and luxuriously presented bathrooms. Usefully, there is also a storage room with the property measured at 15 Sq. Ft. The property also benefits from a recently extended lease.The Millbank Estate is sought after and well-regarded and offers a tremendous location, just behind the Tate Britain and the River Thames. Within walking distance of Parliament Square and Westminster Abbey as well as the Pimlico Grid, the location is desirably quiet but also close to the centre of London and its renowned shops, bars, restaurants and entertainments. Transport links are superb with Pimlico Underground (Victoria Line) and Westminster Underground (District, Circle and Jubilee Lines) for access to Canary Wharf. Victoria Station (District, Circle and Victoria Lines) also offers National Rail Services and the Gatwick Express.
listing.short_description: Set on the first floor of this attractive red-brick building just behind Millbank in the heart of Westminster, this bright three-bedroom apartment is immaculately renovated throughout.

listing.description: In an elevated location between Wargrave and Henley-on-Thames, Dial House sits with a handful of other properties in a South-West facing position looking over the mill stream and a private island. The property comprises of  and has been recently renovated and features high ceilings, period fireplaces and well-proportioned rooms. EPC Rating F.Local informationDial House is less than a mile from the glorious riverside town of Henley-on-Thames, home to the world famous Regatta, and which has comprehensive leisure and shopping facilities including a Waitrose, cafés and specialist shops. The village of Wargrave is 2 miles distant with local shops and riverside pubs and restaurants. Henley and Wargrave railway stations have good services to London, Paddington (from 45 mins and 34 mins respectively) with Crossrail allowing direct access to the City, Canary Wharf, the West End and Heathrow from 2018. The area is well served for schools, both state and private, including Shiplake College, Reading Blue Coat and Queen Anne's in Caversham easily accessible. Connection to the M4 via junction 8/9 and the M40 via the A404M is about 6 miles away with Heathrow under 20 miles distant. There are miles of riding and walking in the surrounding countryside and boating and rowing on the River Thames.AccommodationFrom the courtyard, garage and parking area, a gate leads into the private riverside garden. A verandah provides a sitting and barbecue area and French windows lead into the dining room. This is a lovely room with a woodburning stove, high ceilings and opens onto the kitchen. Fitted with a good range of wall and floor units, there are twin ovens, a gas hob, dishwasher and wine fridge. The next door utility room has a back door and plumbing for washing machine and tumble dryer. The elegant hallway has a mahogany door to the front and a fireplace. Down steps is the cloakroom and a turned staircase leads to the first floor. Positioned to take advantage of views across the river and island, the sitting room has large sash windows and a polished wooden floor and there is an open fireplace with beautiful Art Nouveau surround. A study or library has a further open fire and French windows open to the sun terrace which is paved and provides a secluded seating or sunning area with lovely elevated views. The master bedroom has a newly refitted en-suite wet room. On the second floor are three further spacious double bedrooms, two with lovely views over the river, and there is a family bathroom.Outside spaceThe detached double garage is accessed from the courtyard with an up and over door, power and light. Approached from the paved garden via external steps is the room above the garage, this is well fitted with roof lights and would make a fine home office, recreation room or occasional guest accommodation. The courtyard garden is very private and part-walled, there is a fence at the end with a gate leading to the landing stage. This is a lovely place from which to enjoy the river, there is room for a table and chairs and there is a 29ft mooring on the mill stream with direct access to the River Thames.Local authority and servicesWokingham district councilconveyancingThrough our in house Conveyancing team, we can ensure ease and efficiency for a competitive, no-sale, no-fee quote. Ask us for a quote today.DisclaimerThese particulars are a general guide only. They do not form part of any contract. Services, systems and appliances have not been tested.

listing.description: Property DescriptionThis wonderful property is located in a private lane in the sought after area known as Winterbrook. It offers beautiful views over local countryside.Property DetailsThis outstanding property is believed to have been built in 1959. There have been only 2 owners of the property and the current owners have extended and substantially improved the property over the 10 years they have lived there. The property is located in a sought after lane and properties rarely become available due to the location, a lot of the residents of Winterbrook Lane have lived there for years.Wallingford is located in South Oxfordshire and is surrounded by beautiful countryside. The property takes full advantage of this with a balcony overlooking fields, south facing garden and sliding doors throughout the downstairs. The views can be appreciated in all of the principle rooms of the house.Wallingford Market Place is located just 0.7 miles away giving the feeling of a rural location but with easy access to shops and local amenitiesAs you arrive at the end of Winterbrook Lane the property proudly sits on your left. There is driveway parking for several cars. The front door leads in to a large entrance hall that offers access to the majority of the rooms on the ground floor. Immediately to your right is the family room and immediately to the left the current study. As you make your way round to the right hand side you have the main lounge which has a couple of sliding doors out into the garden from here there is a door that takes you through to the main dining room which currently sits a 14 person dining table also with large double sliding doors out to the garden. The kitchen and dining area offers open plan living which is great for families. Once through the kitchen there is a further utility room and downstairs toilet. There is also side access to the garden via the utility. As you follow the hall back towards the front door you have another downstairs toilet to your right.Upstairs there are six bedrooms, three offering en-suites and a large family bathroom. Again the beautiful views can be appreciated from all of the bedrooms to the rear and side of the property. The master bedroom also offers a balcony with double doors to enjoy the beautiful scenery.
listing.short_description: This wonderful property is located in a private lane in the sought after area known as Winterbrook. It offers beautiful views over local countryside.

listing.description: Tucked away in arguably the best spot in Wallingford, along the private Winterbrook Lane, this gorgeous 6 bedroom detached residence has in excess of  of accommodation, a secluded location - with striking South facing views towards The Ridgeway - yet is just 0.7 miles from the market square.Having been considerably improved by the current owner, the property is in immaculate order throughout, with a stylish modern finish; the home would suit a buyer looking for a substantial family home with bright open reception spaces, a kitchen/breakfast to serve as a 'hub' and access in to the bustling town centre.EPC rating C.Local informationWallingford was a walled Saxon Town on the Thames, and the remains of the town walls can still be seen today. William the Conqueror built Wallingford Castle, which was used as a royal residence until the time of the Black Death. The remains of the Castle can be seen from the Castle Gardens. Today Wallingford is a thriving Market Town; the centre is a major conservation area with examples of churches and architecture dating back to the 14th Century.The landscape from the River Thames is officially designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Being a Town, Wallingford offers every means of amenity one would expect. The narrow streets with their variety of small shops, pubs and restaurants, the antique shops in the Lamb Arcade, and the parks, commons and gardens make it a very pleasant town. Wallingford is within easy reach of both the M40 and the M4, and is conveniently located within access of Henley, Reading, & Oxford.AccommodationSet over two floors the spotless accommodation includes: A kitchen/breakfast room which opens on to the gorgeous rear aspect dining room, with doors leading to the garden, a large rear aspect living room, family room, study, utility room and two cloakrooms.To the first floor there is a large rear aspect master bedroom with en-suite shower room and a balcony with striking views; there are two further en-suite double bedrooms, three bedrooms with fitted wardrobes and a family bathroom.Outside spaceOutside the total plot measures 0.236 acres; to the rear the garden has a Southerly aspect and is unencumbered by surrounding properties so really does have sunshine all day round, there is a patio immediately abutting the rear of the house for entertaining and a large lawn for playing. To the front there is a gated driveway with parking for several vehicles.Local authority and servicesSouth Oxfordshire District Council.  Tax Band F.ConveyancingThrough our in house Conveyancing team, we can ensure ease and efficiency for a competitive, no-sale, no-fee quote. Ask us for a quote today.DisclaimerThese particulars are a general guide only. They do not form part of any contract. Services, systems and appliances have not been tested.

listing.description: Guide price of £1,000,000 to £1,200,000. Impressive grade II listed three bedroom Oast House with attached three bedroom cottage, double bay open garage and sweeping gravel drive set in 1.45 acres of mature gardens on the rural outskirts of the sought after Smarden village.The main Oast House has a wealth of period features with two 14ft roundels offering sitting room with wood burner and dining room with dual aspect windows, family room with large bay window to front aspect, kitchen/breakfast room with pantry and ground floor cloakroom. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms in the roundels one with fitted wardrobes, family shower room, master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and a second shower room, which could easily be converted to an en-suite for the master bedroom.The cottage has its own entrance and offers self contained accommodation with fitted kitchen, shower room, sitting room with vaulted ceiling, wood burner and glazed doors to rear aspect giving great views over the gardens, two double bedrooms, single bedroom, family bathroom and a study room to the first floor.While currently arranged as two properties it could easily be turned back into one dwelling offering flexible accommodation with a multitude of uses.Externally the property is approached by a gravel drive with double garage, the gardens to the front feature mature planting and large pond with the rear garden mainly laid to lawn with mature trees, unique Japanese bamboo garden and vegetable garden along with summerhouse, green house and log cabin.Situated on the outskirts of Smarden village with its two public houses, butchers, village store and primary school, there is also the village primary school at Biddenden just a short drive away or the Homewood secondary school and sixth form centre in St Michaels, Tenterden. For a more comprehensive range of facilities you have the village of Headcorn offering mainline train service to London or Ashford for the high speed service to St Pancras in 37 minutes.Services – Mains Drainage, Water and Electricity.

listing.description: An elegant three bedroom, two bathroom garden apartment with its own entrance forming part of a beautiful Stucco fronted period residence on a popular tree lined street. This exquisitely presented property comprises a spacious reception room with fireplace and bay window, fitted kitchen with access to a utility room, principal bedroom with fitted wardrobes, en-suite shower room and access onto a private 40' west facing garden, two further bedrooms (one with direct access to the private rear garden) and a family bathroom. Priory Terrace is conveniently located for local shops, restaurants and amenities, whilst a combination of Jubilee, Bakerloo, Metropolitan, Overground and Thameslink transport links can be found at Swiss Cottage, Finchley Road, South Hampstead, West Hampstead and Kilburn Park.

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

listing.description: A beautifully appointed detached family house, built by a local builder for his own occupation in 2003, presented with brick elevations under a tiled roof. The property offers excellent family accommodation extending to over 3500 . And is offered for sale with no onward chain.   The ground floor features an open plan fitted kitchen/breakfast room opening to the dining room and family room, forming the hub of the house. In addition, there are three further reception rooms. To the first floor there are five bedrooms with master and guest suites. In addition there is an excellent self contained annexe, ideal for a relative or the purchaser wishing to adapt to office use. All of the principal rooms enjoy a southerly aspect and an internal inspection is highly recommended.SituationOccupying a tucked-away position approached by a private gravel drive, the property is situated on the Hampshire/West Sussex border within about 1.5 miles of Liss which provides a range of shops, mainline station and local school. More comprehensive facilities are available in the towns of Petersfield and Liphook, both about 5 miles distant. There is a wide choice of both state and private schools in the vicinity including Churchers College, Bedales and Bohunt School at Liphook which won the tes School of the Year in 2014. There are many acres of fine countryside close at hand, including much under the ownership of the National Trust.Outsideattached double garage with light and power connected, oil fired boiler serving central heating and hot water systems, electric twin up-and-over doors. Garden Shed. Water Tap. Oil Tank. Outside Lighting. Garden: This is a charming feature of the property providing a secluded and tucked-away position. The property is approached by a long gravel drive and five bar gate with parking for several vehicles. A side gate leads to the rear where there is a wide paved sun terrace with extensive lawns flanked by well stocked borders of flowering and herbaceous shrubs. The rear garden enjoys a southerly aspect and is well enclosed with close boarded fencing and some laurel hedging, affording a good degree of privacy. In all the garden extends to about 0.36 acre.Additional Informationservices: Mains Water and Electricity. Private Drainage. Oil Fired Cental Heating. Double Glazing.Local authority: Chichester District Council, East Pallant House, East Pallant, Chichester PO19 1TY
listing.short_description: An individually built detached family house of over 3100 square feet with separate annexe/home office, approached by a long drive and occupying a tucked-away position . No onward chain. Internal viewing strongly recommended.

listing.description: Picturesque Four Bedroom Terraced House with South Facing Garden - chain freeOriginal detail runs through this charming terraced house on Malfort Road. Running from Ivanhoe Road to Grove Hill Road, this pretty street is very appealing for families and professionals, located around the corner from Champion Hill and the beautiful Camberwell Grove. The houses here are all well preserved, many having original sash windows, plus there's a strong community spirit amongst the neighbours. East Dulwich, Bellenden Road and Camberwell are all within walking distance - you really are magnificently placed. This idyllic property has four bedrooms, two receptions (including dining room), plus two bathrooms.This house is slightly elevated and has a contemporary front garden with steps up to the door. Inside, a typical Victorian layout stretches ahead, but having a sweeping curved wall to your right. This is where the reception room can be found fronting the street, housing original coving overhead and an original fireplace with solid marble surround. Behind this room is a delightfully surprising bedroom leading into a sun room/conservatory with glass roof, a cute addition for some extra space. French doors at the far end take you out into the decked garden.Further down the hall, you pass an understairs cupboard that takes you down to the old coal cellar, ideal for storing your bits and bobs, while to your right is a shower room and w.C. Opposite this is a further storage cupboard, while heading on you find the second reception, currently used as a dining room. This space opens directly into the kitchen at the rear, so it’s current use is what one would typically do. A huge side aspect window draws in light and there is an extremely modern concrete floor. The kitchen has an awesome double butler's sink, white units and natural tumbled slate splashbacks. A back door leads out to a sunny south facing garden with a decked seating area and surrounding raised beds.Upstairs, the landing is split by a few steps up towards the front of the property. Stretching across the width of the house is a glorious master bedroom with a bay window and single sash to one side. Exposed brickwork covers the chimney breast. Next door is a second double with cast iron fireplace and garden views. A separate w.C comes before the main bathroom which has a white suite with a shower attachment and heated towel rail. A fourth double at the rear has neutral walls and oatmeal carpets and is quietly tucked away overlooking the garden.Very nicely located on all fronts this home offers easy access to both the City and central London – walk eight minutes to Denmark Hill station for regular services to Victoria and London Bridge. East Dulwich is within 10 minutes’ walk for good services to London Bridge too. Alternatively catch a 185 or 176 from the top of the street. Shopping is a cinch with Sainsbury’s two minutes away and the delis of East Dulwich a little further. Going out? Lordship Lane has an ever expanding number of cool bars and restaurants and there are more in nearby Bellenden Road. Dog Kennel Hill School has an exemplary record and is close by. For active pursuits the Peckham Pulse is a jog away or spend a few hours at the library and then go on to the cinema on Rye Lane!

listing.letting_fees:
Transparency for tenants

Once you've found the perfect property and your offer has been accepted, we'll start preparing the tenancy agreement and organising the logistics for your 'move-in' day. The tenancy charges may vary, depending on the agreement we have with the landlord, so it's best to ask the Marsh & Parsons office dealing with your offer for a full break down of costs.

That said, we don't want you to have any unwelcome surprises when it comes to signing the contract, so here's a list of what you can typically expect to pay:

Pre-Tenancy All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)

Tenancy Agreement / Admin Fee £270
Referencing Fee £30 per reference (including references for any proposed Guarantor)
Check-in Fee £130.80
Deposit Typically six weeks rent
Pet Deposit Returnable additional security deposit, equivalent to two weeks' rent

During your tenancy (if required) All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)
Renewal Document Fee £72
Change of Occupancy £120
Future Landlord Reference Fee £36

For more information regarding the lettings process, please visit the Lettings Advice for Tenants page.


Fees explained


Tenancy Agreement/Admin Fee - Provision of an expertly written tenancy agreement, brokering agreed amendments between landlord and tenant, and arrangement for completion and signature of the agreement by both parties, and registering your deposit with the Tenancy Deposit Scheme. Your deposit is typically six weeks rent.

Referencing Fee - The cost of referencing includes checking your credit status, previous employer, current or past landlords, and taking into account any other information to help assess the affordability of your tenancy application.

Check-in Fee - The cost of arranging for a clerk to meet you and agree the current inventory of the property at the start of your tenancy. The cost of the check-out at the end of the tenancy is met by the landlord.

Pet Deposit (Returnable) - To cover the added risk of property damage. This will be protected with your security deposit and may be returned at the end of the tenancy.

Renewal Document Fee - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Change of Occupancy - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Future Landlord Reference Fee - Collating information and preparing a reference for a future landlord or letting agent.
listing.description: Located in a desirable portered block on the River Thames this excellent front line ground floor apartment has been immaculately refurbished by the current owners who have taken every care over the flat; from a single style of wood throughout to every twist and turn of the kitchen units and bookshelves fitting perfectly into their ideal space.The main living room looks straight across to the Barnes side boathouse and playing fields beyond whilst also leading out onto the west facing terrace which runs along the length of the apartment. An open plan kitchen has been forensically set out; with a phenomenal amount of storage space, a fitted double fridge and a built in bbq. Every item of convenient has been fitted into this perfect cooking space.Lutron lighting abounds throughout and both bedrooms hold ample storage space and fitted cupboards with a work station in the master bedroom. Under floor heating (water based) provides a beautifully warm environment for the apartment. The property comes with an allocated parking space and is part of a wonderful waterside complex. River Gardens is a modern development on the banks of the River Thames with attractive communal gardens and close to Bishops Park and the Fulham Palace Road. There are excellent transport links with Hammersmith and Putney bridge tube stations nearby, whilst the A3 and the M4 are very accessible.
listing.short_description: Magnificent front line riverside flat with direct views across to the Barnes side of the River Thames
listing.displayable_address: Elm Lodge, 75 Stevenage Road, London SW6

listing.description: This stunning period house, believed to date to the 16th century was originally a medieval Hall House and has been sympathetically extended over the years to offer versatile and well proportioned accommodation, with modern environmentally friendly additions such as air source heat pumps and solar panels. This charismatic Grade II listed farmhouse offers immense charm with many period features including heavy hardwood stable doors, exposed beams, feature inglenook fireplaces and leaded light windows. The accommodation is arranged over two floors with a unique 'T' shaped layout and benefiting from unusually high ceilings for the period. The spacious kitchen / breakfast room is a warm and comfortable family space with wooden cabinetry and electric Aga. The double aspect sitting room to the front of the property has a wonderful inglenook fireplace, while the spacious dining room is full of character with a similar inglenook fireplace. A study/office, utility room, pump room and bathroom complete the layout on the ground floor. On the first floor is a master bedroom suite with dressing area and ensuite bathroom with corner bath and under floor heating. There are three further bedrooms one with ensuite bathroom and a family bathroom.SituationThe property enjoys a delightful rural setting on the edge of the sought after village of Outwood. The village in addition to its historic windmill, has a attractive common surrounded by National Trust woodland, ideal for walking. Local shopping and dining needs can be found in Bletchingley, some 4 miles away, while the larger town of Redhill (approx 5.6 miles distant) has a full range of shops and rail station with journey times into London approximately 30 minutes. The national motorway network is accessible at the M25 J6,6 miles away. Nearby are a number of schools for all age groups in both the private and state sectors including The Hawthorns, Dunottar, Reigate Grammar, Caterham School and Notre Dame in Lingfield.OutsideThe house is set back from the road and approached via a five bar gate leading to a gravel parking area providing parking for several cars. The grounds surround the house on three sides with lawns, mature hedgerows and trees. Terracing has been created with Horsham slabs to the rear, ideal for entertaining in the summer months with a wonderful wisteria scrambling over the exterior of the house. Herbaceous borders are stocked with spring and summer plants, shrubs and trees. To the side of the house there are equestrian facilities that include a stable yard and tack room with a paddock that benefits from access to a separate driveway.Kitchen Breakfast Room Utility Room Sitting Room Dining Room Study Bedroom Bathroom Ensuite Bathroom Garden
listing.short_description: Within a lovely setting and with views across its own land Rookery Farm is a Grade II sixteenth century Hall House of immense charm offering flexible accommodation with formal gardens, stables, paddock and field approaching 3.5 acres.

listing.description: An attractive 1930's detached house, which is situated on a wide plot with a carriage driveway and is set back from the road. The property offers excellent potential for development (subject to the necessary consents) and has the benefit of a one bedroom annex to the side. The main house comprises an entrance hall, ground floor shower room, large living room, dining room, kitchen, utility, three bedrooms and a bathroom. There is also an attached two-storey one bedroom annex with its own entrance, spacious living room, kitchen/dining room, and a bathroom and is currently let for £750pcm. The rear garden is approximately 120ft at the longest point and the total plot stretches to 0.17 acre. Furthermore there is a double garage to the side of the property. Found on Sandpit Lane in Marshalswick, close to Rose Walk, this property enjoys ease of access to local shopping at The Quadrant and is only 1.5 miles to the mainline railway station. Marshalswick and the surrounding areas are well sought after for the outstanding primary and secondary schools. Energy Rating E.DirectionsStarting at the Marshalswick office, take a right on The Ridgeway. At the roundabout take a left onto Marshalswick Lane, then left at the traffic lights into Sandpit Lane. With two primary schools, Clapham Junction rail hub and Clapham Common all being with half a mile the house is well suited to a family. Inside there are three bright, double bedrooms and a smart family bathroom on the first floor. On the ground floor there is a guest WC and plenty of room for entertainment and relaxation in the spacious double reception room which has solid wood floors and leads out to an easy to maintain South Westerly facing patio garden which can also be accessed from the kitchen breakfast room. The loft has not yet been converted therefore offering extra storage space or an opportunity to add space and value. listing.description: SummaryA stunning detached property, situated on a large plot in the sought after area of Thorpe Road in Longthorpe. The property has been well maintained and improved by the current owners and has a spacious and contemporary feel throughout whilst retaining original features...DescriptionA stunning detached property, situated on a large plot in the sought after area of Thorpe Road in Longthorpe. The property has been well maintained and improved by the current owners and has a spacious and contemporary feel throughout whilst retaining original features including stone fireplaces and high ceilings. The property briefly comprises of an impressive entrance hall, four large reception rooms, a spacious family kitchen, utility room, boot room, downstairs cloakroom, a large re-fitted family bathroom and four double bedrooms with en-suite to the master and second bedroom. The property also benefits from beautiful landscaped rear gardens and an outdoor heated swimming pool.The property is entered via a large storm porch with tiled flooring and has a beautiful established wisteria growing across the façade. The impressive entrance hall has stairs to first floor and doors giving access to the reception rooms, kitchen and also to a downstairs cloakroom. To the front of the property is a dining room, currently being used as a large study, with fireplace, high ceilings and windows overlooking the front garden. The family /play room has a bay window and patio doors overlooking the swimming pool.To the rear of the entrance hall double doors give access to a family kitchen, fitted with a range of built in appliances, base and wall units light granite work surfaces over. The kitchen gives access to a large formal drawing room, a utility room, boot room and a further sitting room. The drawing room is an impressive formal space with stone fireplace and inset contemporary gas burning stove, cornice and large picture windows and doors overlooking the gardens to both the side and rear aspect. The sitting room is open plan to the kitchen and is a great family area with large windows and doors overlooking the gardens. The utility room is of a good size and is fitted with a range of base and full height units with worktops and sink, leading through a further door is a utility/boot room with laundry facilities and access door into the garage.On the first floor, the landing is split level with the lower level giving access to the guest bedroom and the galleried landing gives access to the further three bedrooms including the master and also to the large family bathroom. The guest bedroom has windows overlooking the front garden, a dressing room and en-suite shower room. The master also has a large en-suite shower room and windows overlooking the front garden. The further two bedrooms are to the side and rear of the property with one benefitting from en-suite facilities. The spacious family bathroom is fitted with a contemporary suite and has a beautiful sunken bath with granite surfaces and also inset his 'n' hers sinks.OutsideThe property is accessed via wrought iron gates onto a sweeping hard standing driveway providing parking for several vehicles. The landscaped front gardens feature shrubs, borders and mature trees, with the rear garden mainly laid to lawn with a variety of shrubs, borders, mature trees and plants, all enclosed by fencing and hedging. A large patio area houses a heated swimming pool and further seating areas.LocationThorpe Road is a popular and central location in Longthorpe, Peterborough, situated close to the City Centre which is approximately two miles away and has the main shopping district and offering a diverse range of restaurants and eateries, extensive retail opportunity, medical centre, the historic Cathedral and also with the main line train station providing fast and frequent rail links into London Kings Cross, with an advertised journey time of around 50 minutes. Ferry Meadows Country Park can be found nearby and offers walking and cycling routes, as well as extensive outdoor recreational activities such as water sports, golf courses, children's play parks and cafes. With the beautiful open rolling countryside of Cambridgeshire, Northamptonshire, Rutland and Norfolk all very accessible.1. listing.description: West facing four bedroom detached home with double length garage on a desirable tree lined residential road moments from Esher Rail Station. In close proximity to a range of highly regarded state and independent schools like Cranmere and Esher High School, this well located property offers access to the many amenities on the high streets of Esher and Hampton Court Village. Planning application 2016/2839 has been approved and can be found on the Elmbridge Planning site. This gives the next owner the opportunity to add a double storey rear extension and convert the garage to create a stunning kitchen entertaining area with an exquisite master suite above.Traversing the gravel driveway, the scene is set with a welcoming entrance hall that leads to two receptions and the kitchen.There is an inviting front aspect formal reception with bay window and a double length rear aspect reception with an attractive open brick feature fireplace and access to the pretty rear garden. The double reception room links through to the kitchen breakfast room and a separate utility room. The first floor comprises four well proportioned bedrooms benefitting from a modern family bathroom.

Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

listing.letting_fees:
For a detailed version of Lawlors Services & Fees Explained, please visit our website: Or ask a member of staff.


Lawlors services & fees explained


Note: All charges listed below are the maximum fees that will be applied depending on both your circumstances and the number of tenants. At Lawlors we aim to be as transparent as possible when disclosing any charges or fees. Please bear in mind changes such as seasonal promotions do occur so contact our lettings branch directly for an accurate assessment of your rental needs.


Tenancy application/references


When a suitable property to rent has been found all persons aged eighteen or over will complete an Application Form and will be named in the Tenancy Agreement. We will take up references on behalf of our client, your landlord, which may include a bank reference for which your bank may charge a nominal fee, a credit reference, an employer's reference, an accountant¿s reference, and a previous landlord reference. A payment to indicate your commitment is required when you submit your application and is held against expenses and fees incurred. If your application is successful this payment will be deducted from your Initial Money. The payment is non-refundable should your application be unsuccessful or withdrawn in certain circumstances, the details of which are set out in the tinfo (Tenant Information Sheet). Please note that this payment in advance does not constitute a tenancy or offer of a tenancy but is proof of your serious intention to proceed.


Tenancy agreement


Before any tenancy begins you will sign a Tenancy Agreement setting out the landlord's and tenant's obligations. A charge of £250 is made for the preparation of the
original Agreement and a further £100 for any extension Agreement(s) subsequently entered into. Once the Tenancy Agreement has been executed by you and the
landlord it is binding. Should your circumstances changes and the tenancy agreement need amending at any point during the tenancy you must inform us and, subject to your landlord's agreement (which might include the need to take up new references) we will prepare new documents for signature. Our fee for this will be £300 plus any applicable referencing.


Security deposit


Before your tenancy commences you will be required to pay a security deposit which will be a minimum of one month's rent. This deposit is held by us as stakeholders or passed to your landlord. The deposit is held against any damages or expenses arising during your tenancy and will not be released until after you vacate the property, all rent has been paid up to date and we have written confirmation of any costs for damages from both parties. No interest on'the deposit is payable to either party.

The Initial Money consists of:
- First month's rent (Subject to Landlord)
- Security Deposit, minimum one month's rent
- Administration Fee one week's rent
- Full Referencing Fee £144 per tenant
- Part Referencing Fee £60 per tenant
- If there are any guarantors to the tenancy:
- Guarantor Referencing Fee £144 per guarantor
- Guarantor Agreement Fee £150

If the tenant is a company:
- Company Referencing Fee £144 per company

Other Charges:
- Additional copy of tenancy agreement £25
- Change of Sharer £250
- Extension Agreements £100
- Missed Appointment Charge £30

End of tenancy:
- Outgoing reference fee £35
- Locksmith administration and attendance charge £100

Optional extras:
- Express Move-In within 3 days £150

listing.description: This huge 1732 sq ft, loft-style, three double bedroom, two bathroom apartment in this sought after school conversion is a rare find. Boasting the great floor to ceiling windows typical of school conversions, the space is flooded with light, enjoys double height ceilings, wood flooring, state of the art appliances and beautifully finished bathrooms; one of which has a Jacuzzi and a shower that doubles as a steam-room, that all offers the sense of luxury, while a truly enormous open plan reception area offers the lifestyle to boot. The apartment has two private front doors, so purchasers will benefit from use of the manicured communal gardens, without having to share a communal entrance area. This apartment is split over two floors and due to the large square footage and layout, the property can be configured differently to suit a potential purchasers search criteria. The property has a multitude of selling points, to name a few; an owned secure off street parking space, two bathrooms, own entrances, CCTV, a substantial double bedroom with enough floor space to have a reading/relaxation area nestled within the room. You will be hard-pressed to find comparable properties with dimensions that rival this maisonette and the total internal floor space will be similar to period houses within the immediate vicinity with higher asking prices. With its own front doors and large internal square footage, this property is a feasible alternative to period properties which often require a higher level of up-keep. The property is only a short walk from the vibrant shops, nightlife and culinary marvels of Clapham and Brixton, as well as both Clapham Common and Brockwell Park. Excellent connections to the City and the West End through Clapham Common, Clapham North and Brixton underground stations and Clapham High Street mainline station. Because this space is truly magnificent, we expect competition and a high level of interest, and thus strongly recommend pre-registration. We will be holding structured viewings on a first-come, first-served basis. Call now for your choice of viewing slot.

listing.description: This beautifully refurbished home can be found on a private road that leads to the footpaths and trails that meander through the South Foreland Valley, a protected area of Special Scientific Interest around St. Margaret’s Bay, so is very quiet and peaceful. From the moment you walk through the front door into the very spacious and welcoming entrance hall, you will be mesmerised by the view. Whether you rush straight outside through one of the two sets of French doors onto the terrace to get a better look or wander through the bevelled glass doors into the light and elegant lounge with its two sets of French doors leading directly onto the terrace, bookshelves (handmade by Thoroughly Wood) and attractive fireplace, it is still the view across the countryside, white cliffs and the sea that takes your breath away. At night, in the winter, the clear skies make it an excellent spot for anyone interested in astronomy. There is a delightful open-plan feel about this lovely home as you flow through from the hall to the dining room and the sitting area to the modern bespoke kitchen and breakfast area designed by City Kitchens of Canterbury. It includes a built-in double oven, microwave and hob, integrated Miele dishwasher, fridge, freezer and washing machine while the large breakfast area also has double French doors to the terrace so you can sit here and enjoy the great outdoors. There is a large study overlooking the gardens, as well as a separate bedroom and bathroom accessed through glass doors. As the older ‘cottage’ part of the house was built at the turn of the last century and the newer extension was added circa 2002, the house has two staircases. The first leads to the master bedroom with its wall of mirrored and wood wardrobes, modern bathroom with bath, power shower and underfloor heating, as well as two superb balconies where you can sit over your morning coffee admiring the view or enjoy a nightcap watching the twinkling lights of Calais. Another double bedroom and bathroom up the second staircase provides guests or family members with their own private, en suite facilities.What the Owner says:We have lived in our lovely home for the past 10 years and spent a year completely remodelling it. Our aim has been to create a wonderful place to live, with the emphasis on a light and airy environment where most of the windows and the six sets of French doors look out onto the magnificent views of the Channel and South Foreland Valley. We wanted to make a home andnot just refurbish a house, and hope the next owners will be able to enjoy it as much as we have – whether they are looking for a permanent home or a lovely weekend and holiday retreat. St. Margaret’s is a very community-spirited village and has been home to a number of well-known celebrities. Peter Ustinov bought a small military building on the clifftop. Noel Coward owned White Cliffs, which he subsequently sold to Ian Fleming, the creator of James Bond. It is thought that Ian Fleming based his character James Bond’s code name 007 on the bus service which ran from Deal to London. There are two hotels and two public houses as well as a post office, village shop and a regular bus service to Dover, Deal and Canterbury and a wide range of societies and clubs. Residents are also able to use the St. Margaret’s resort, making use of the gym, sauna and swimming pool. You will find plenty of wonderful walks from virtually outside the front door to Kingsdown, the Dover Patrol Memorial and the SouthForeland Lighthouse – the first in the world with electric light. listing.description: Plot two is the ex-show home of the Claremont development, ‘The Marlborough’ presents a remarkably spacious five bedroom, semi-detached home benefiting from being part of a secure gated development and only 1.5 miles to Ascot main line station.With an imposing exterior look the white stone steps lead up to the wide Georgian style front door and gives a grand and inviting feeling before you have even stepped over the threshold to a welcoming hallway. With double doors opening on to the first level offering a bright dining room with tall sash windows, a guest WC and cloak/storage room under the stairs. The hallway stairs lead down to the ground floor and beautiful open plan kitchen/family room with flexible living space which is likely to become the heart of the home with modern cream gloss kitchen, all integral appliances and French doors opening up to a patio area and individually landscaped garden. From the kitchen there is a separate utility room, another WC and an internal door to a double garage. The first floor offers a 23’7 x 20’6 living room with three sets of French doors with Juliette balconies overlooking the garden.The house also offers four double bedrooms (two with en-suites and dressing rooms) one single bedroom, a study and two fully tiled family bathrooms. The master bedroom located on the top floor offers a true sense of luxurious living with 15’1 x 15’1 main room, his and hers dressing rooms, fully tiled en- suite with his and her sinks, separate shower and bath.Outside there is driveway parking for two cars, a double garage, outside storage under the main front steps and side access to a south facing enclosed rear garden.Located 0.3 of a mile away from Sunninghill high street with local amenities ranging from small independent retailers and boutiques to local cafes, bistros and delicatessens. Viewing is highly recommended.

listing.description: This individual, period, thatched cottage is situated down this tree lined road on Honey Hill, on the border between Crowthorne and the market town of Wokingham. The property is positioned on a large wide plot with views looking out onto fields and open countryside. To the front there is an 'in and out' drive, plus a second driveway offering access to four different garages and outbuildings.Internally there is a sitting room, living/dining room, modern kitchen, utility room, shower room and four double bedrooms. The master bedroom has a refitted en-suite bathroom, whilst the fourth bedroom also has an en-suite as well as its own independent access, ideal for an older child or even a home office.Although in a rural setting, there is easy access to the surrounding towns and rail and road links, via Crowthorne and Wokingham station and 329M and M4 motorways.

listing.description: This most attractive grade II listed thatched cottage is believed to date back to the 15th Century and offers a wealth of character and charisma expected in a property of this age whilst providing all the home comforts of modern family living, in one of the most prominent and convenient locations within this beautiful village.Burnham Cottage is a generously proportioned home and has been sympathetically renovated and updated by the current owners including a stunning vaulted garden room conversion complete with wood burning stove, underfloor heating and bi-folding doors onto the garden.The flexible living accommodation exudes character with latch doors, exposed beams and open fireplaces. Downstairs are no less than five receptions, a rear lobby which incorporates a guest cloakroom and utility area, a stunning kitchen/breakfast room with a range of bespoke oak units, granite worktops, a host of quality appliances, central island with breakfast bar and underfloor heating. The kitchen leads through to the stunning garden room overlooking the terrace and gardens.The first floor opens onto a spacious landing with built in storage and provides access to a vaulted master bedroom with en-suite shower room, three further bedrooms and a contemporary family bathroom with Jacuzzi bath and separate shower cubicle.Outside the beautiful mature gardens offer a sunny south facing aspect and a high level of seclusion with attractive well stocked borders and landscaping with a travertine terrace leading onto a generous lawn area. Leading off the rear of the cottage, a slate tiled loggia sits above an original cobbled floor and provides external covered access to a cellar. Also within the garden is a timber shed and further detached outbuilding offering additional storage. The cottage also has the added advantage of a generous driveway for a number of vehicles to the side which is accessed from the garden. From here further entry to the cottage is via a door to the kitchen. There is further access to the garden to the right of the house. No onward chain.Services and additional information.Mains water, drainage, gas & electricityLocal Authority: Aylesbury Vale District CouncilCouncil Tax Band: G
listing.short_description: This most attractive Grade Two listed thatched village cottage is believed to date back to the 15th Century and offers a wealth of character and charisma expected in a property of this age whilst providing all the home comforts of modern family living.Set in a quiet road in one of the area's most attractive and vibrant villages with a good local pub at the end of the road whether you turn left or right! Perfect for the commuter too, with Thame & Haddenham mainline station within a short drive.

listing.description: A stunning grade II* listed farmhouse. 4 reception rooms, fabulous kitchen/breakfast room, 4/5 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. Delightful gardens, workshop/stables and 12 acre paddock.The property is a well maintained and beautifully presented listed property (Grade 2* - considered to be of regional importance), full of period features including inglenook fireplaces, beams in many rooms, panelled walls and flagstone floors. Unusually for an old period farmhouse, the layout of rooms is very well suited to modern living, with the reception rooms being of good sizes and connecting together very well. The house is almost fully double glazed. In addition there are 2 separate staircases which offer a flexible use of the space.On entering the property the period features are immediately evident. The hallway, with plank and muntin screen and old quarry tiled floor, leads through to the ancient buttery with timber balusters, which is currently used as a cloakroom. To the rear is a light and airy study and WC. This lends itself to downstairs en-suite facilities if required.The sitting room is a truly delightful room. It is heavily beamed with an inglenook fireplace containing a wood burning fire, and built-in cupboard fronted with antique reclaimed wood. The Ham Stone front mullion window has a window seat and overlooks the cottage-style garden.The kitchen/breakfast room is the real heart of the home with an oil/electric Aga built into a fireplace with timber beam over. A stone mullioned window with window seat overlooks the front garden and there is plenty of space to accommodate a dining table. The floor features original flagstones, and the units comprise granite work surfaces with hand-made limed oak and cream units with integrated dish washer. To the rear is the utility room leading to the rear garden.From the kitchen, double doors lead to the dining room, which again has a host of period features and is a wonderful room for entertaining. Beyond the dining room and at the East end of the house is a very light and spacious morning room with access to the garden, staircase to a twin bedroom with views over the rear garden and fields, and stylish bathroom. This part of the house can be configured as separate living accommodation if required.First floor:Still in the oldest part of the house, the master bedroom has a handsome Ham Stone fireplace, a wardrobe disguised behind the wood panelling and a small arched stone window. Off the bedroom there is a dressing area which then leads to a good sized en-suite bathroom. An old, latched, wooden door leads to very large boarded attic.A further bedroom along the landing features an old timber window to the rear garden and large en-suite bathroom which is also accessible from the landing.The third bedroom is "The Cheese Room" named because of its previous incarnation as a store room for truckles of cheese, clearly remembered by Mrs Fox who lived in the house in the 1950s and subsequently lived in one of the stone cottages directly opposite. The Cheese Room has been divided into two rooms, one overlooking the front garden, and one with views to the rear garden.Barn/stable blockA substantial 18m x 9m barn lies within the curtilage of the property. Recently renovated, it comprises potential stabling for 4 horses, has vehicle access and a 12m x 6m mezzanine workshop area with clear roof panels, power and water.Situated in the popular village of Leigh, renowned for its vibrant community, the village lies some five miles southwest of the beautiful abbey town of Sherborne with its famous private schools, and just a few miles from Leweston School. Buses stop at the old village cross in the village centre and provide transport to local state schools.

listing.description: The first thing that strikes you when you enter the property is the feeling of light and space.The grand entrance hall leads onto the well-presented kitchen, fitted to a high standard. The lounge is of epic proportions perfect for the family functions.As you ascend to the first floor, you’re greeted by one of the most awe-inspiring master bedroom suites - spacious and with the added bonus of a large dressing room and en-suite bathroom.The first floor also has two further double bedrooms and an enviable bathroom suite.The current owners have made many improvements to the property since they moved in, including going up into the loft space.Two further bedrooms (one with en-suite), a bathroom and a study have been added, with each bedroom benefiting from a dormer window to provide extra headroom.One of the key features of the property is that all but one of the bedrooms have a rear aspect making the most of the peace and tranquillity that comes with the views over the green belt land.Externally, the property boasts a large garden with heated outdoor swimming pool perfect for entertaining.The front and side aspect offers several parking options along with a double garage that is currently being utilised as a gym/games room.All of this, and only just over a mile from Epping – this property is the complete package!What the Owner says:After moving from Central London, we were amazed at the sheer scale of this property. There were improvements we knew we had to make to make it the perfect family home, but it has all been worth the time and effort.Our master bedroom suite is one of our favourite features of the property, we know we are never going to have anything like it in our next property and we will miss it dearly.One thing we will take away with us is the many happy memories we have entertaining our guests in the garden and the games room. If only we could take away the sunset over the Green Belt land to the rear too!Room sizes:Entrance HallLounge 23'8 x 16'1 (7.22m x 4.91m)Dining Area 23'8 x 11'1 (7.22m x 3.38m)Conservatory 14'5 x 12'5 (4.40m x 3.79m)Games Room 17'4 x 15'2 (5.29m x 4.63m)Kitchen 19'0 x 11'4 (5.80m x 3.46m)Conservatory/Breakfast Room 12'0 x 9'6 (3.66m x 2.90m)Utility Room 11'8 x 4'3 (3.56m x 1.30m)CloakroomLandingBedroom 1 27'4 x 14'1 (8.34m x 4.30m)Dressing Room 15'0 x 10'3 (4.58m x 3.13m)En-Suite Bathroom 10'6 x 10'2 (3.20m x 3.10m)Bedroom 2 11'4 x 11'1 (3.46m x 3.38m)Bedroom 3 11'4 x 10'1 (3.46m x 3.08m)BathroomBedroom 4 18'9 x 10'2 (5.72m x 3.10m)En-Suite Shower RoomBedroom 5 18'4 x 15'4 (5.59m x 4.68m)Bedroom 6/Study 13'1 x 7'7 (3.99m x 2.31m)BathroomGated GardensSwimming PoolDouble Garage & ParkingThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

listing.description: A spacious and light 4 bedroom maisonette with private garden and terrace in this period Collins Build in central Muswell Hill. This flat has a wealth of period features and stunning far reaching views from reception room and attractive views from the kitchen and master bedroom of the unique garden. The kitchen has been finsihed to a high standard along with the bathroom and large shower room. There is well thought out storage in the master bedroom and french doors that open onto the private balcony. The large shed in the garden has electricity and could be tranformed into a great home office.SituationSpringfield is in very close proximity to Muswell Hill Primary School and just a couple of hundred meters to the Broadway, with its range of places to eat, shop and drink. Nearby bus routes provide access into town or links to stations at Finsbury Park or Highgate, while the open green space of Alexandra Park and Highgate Woods are also in the vicinity. Nearby schools include Muswell Hill Primary.

listing.description: The Buckingham, A 5-Bed/2-Bath Detached family house that is part of Sandbrook Park, a beautiful example of luxury living by David Wilson Homes, located in the desirable town of Bushey just 11 minutes from Watford and within easy commuting distance of London.Each new home within this spectacular development has been designed and built to the exceptional standards of build and specification our customers have come to expect from their David Wilson Home.The development consist of 3,4, & 5 Bed Homes located in Bushey.Features:- Symphony design Kitchen/Family Room with oven, hob and extractor, plumbing and space for Fridge/Freezer, Dishwasher and Washer/Dryer- Utility Room- Guest Cloakroom- Lounge- Dining Room- Study- Ensuite Bathroom to Bedroom 1- Dressing Room- Double Garage- GCH to radiators- Turfed garden- 5-Year David Wilson warranty (excluding flooring and garden)For further information, please contact Preston Bennett New Homes on .The pictures you see may not be indicative of this property. They could be cgi's or pictures of the Development Show Apartment or Show Home.SituationBushey is one of Hertfordshire's most desired towns. Great schools and easy commuting into London are part of its attraction as a place to raise a family. Only 1¼ miles from the High Road, Sandbrook Park, sits amongst open greenery (much of it Green Belt) and is still close to Ofsted-rated Good schools. The major towns of Watford, Harrow and St Albans are readily accessible whilst the national rail and motorway networks are all close by.

listing.description: Property DescriptionFour bedroom detached family home with plenty of potential in a highly desirable area is this substantial property on a 1/3 of an acre of land.Property DetailsThis substantial four bedroom detached property has no onward chain and is ideally located on a beautiful tree lined road in an extremely sought after area. The property is approximately 2.5 miles to Woking town centre which offers a wide variety of shops, restaurants, local amenities and the mainline train station that gets you to London Waterloo in under 25 minutes. The property is also within close proximity to local pubs, schools and Sutton Green Golf Club. Internally this impressive house is in need of refurbishment throughout but has plenty of potential with all the rooms being very well proportioned. Externally there is a lovely rear garden of approximately 1/3 of an acre which can be accessed via two of the reception rooms and a side gate to the front driveway. In addition to the driveway parking there is a double garage with access through a gated covered walk way. There is also potential to extend subject to planning permission. Internal photos to follow when the property has been cleared out. Viewings are highly recommended.

listing.description: Preston Baker are pleased to introduce to the market this unique opportunity to acquire this spectacular five bedroom detached family home set in the heart of Doncaster. This gated property benefits from excellent road and public transport links ideal for commuters, extensive and varied local amenities and a favourable school catchment. Additionally the property benefits from its close proximity to the Town centre, Racecourse, Lakeside and Lakeside Village. Comprising of five bedrooms, two reception rooms, four bathrooms, kitchen, utility room, games room, office, extensive gardens and rear balcony this stand-alone property really has to be viewed.The property is accessed via a grand entrance door leading into the porch and in turn hallway. The vast double aspect living room includes an impressive feature fireplace and bi-folding doors leading out to the patio and garden beyond. The office/conservatory boasts views over the rear garden. The open plan kitchen dining room has a bright and spacious fell with bi-folding doors allowing light to flood the room. The high spec kitchen boasts well-appointed wall and base units, beautiful worktops and a huge range of integrated appliances; a utility room accommodates all your washing appliances. To the front of the property is the first of a number of spacious double bedrooms, this one benefiting from a modern en suite shower room.To the first floor there are four additional double bedrooms two of which boasting en suite bathrooms. The house shower room showcases a three piece suite consisting of corner shower, wash basin and toilet.Externally the property benefits from a large patio and extremely lengthy grassed garden which is surrounded by mature plant and trees. To the front is a large grassed garden and a wealth of off street parking with the use of a double garage and horse shoe drive.

listing.description: Tucked away in a quiet courtyard and set within a stunning warehouse conversion, is this lateral two bedroom loft apartment.The space is beautifully presented featuring exposed brickwork, wooden flooring and timber beams. Leading off the hallway are two larger than average double bedrooms, one of which is en-suite both with plenty of space for storage. The open plan kitchen and living room is ideal for anyone looking to impress and entertain. This unique property would make a perfect home or pied-à-terre for anyone who wants to live in the heart of fashionable Spitalfields and Shoreditch.SituationWheler Street is located just off the Shoreditch end of Commercial Street, so is ideally located for all the shops, bars and restaurants that Spitalfields as well as trendy Brick Lane and Shoreditch have to offer. It is within easy reach of Liverpool Street Station (Circle, Central and Hammersmith & City tube lines, and mainline rail services) as well as the East London Overground line at nearby Shoreditch High Street. The introduction of Crossrail (Elizabeth Line) will be a welcome addition to the already excellent transport links, thus being a very attractive area for future investment.
listing.short_description: Tucked away in a quiet courtyard and set within a stunning warehouse conversion, is this lateral two bedroom loft apartment.

listing.description: Accommodation SummaryImpressive family residenceBeautiful formal gardens and groundsStables and paddockSwimming poolFive bedrooms (Four en suite)Three reception roomsDetached office and shower roomDirectionsFrom Exeter city centre head north along Western Way. At the roundabout take the second exit onto Old Tiverton Road. At the next roundabout take the second exit onto Stoke Hill passing Collins Road on your left-hand and the community hall on your right. Go over a bridge and up the hill where the entrance to the driveway can be found on your left side with a white sign marked The Grange opposite. If you reach the narrowing in the road you have gone too far.SituationThe Grange lies on the north eastern fringes of Exeter, less than two miles from the city centre and the University of Exeter, with good opportunities for horse riding countryside and woodland walks close-by.Exeter is one of the uk's most sought-after cities in which to live. It has a vibrant centre with excellent shopping facilities, cafes, bars and restaurants, along with good schools and further education facilities together with fine sports, leisure and entertainment facilities. Mainline train services link to London Paddington and Waterloo and a busy International Airport is within twenty minutes drive.DescriptionThe Grange is an impressive detached residence in an elevated position, on the edge of the city, enjoying views over Exeter and towards the Exe Estuary. Immaculately presented throughout, with spacious large reception rooms, and large windows offering plenty of natural light. 24' kitchen/breakfast room with oil fired Aga and separate large utility room. Five bedrooms (four having en-suite facilities). Attic potential. The stunning grounds surrounding the property include a lovely outdoor pool and pool house. At the top of the land is a fenced paddock plus stabling and tack room. The property is approached by a long drive and offers ample parking and garaging.The accommodation comprisesground floor Pillared portico entrance with double doors leading into the..Entrance hallway12'4" x 10'2" (3.76m x 3.1m). Double glazed window to front. Two walk-in cloaks cupboards with opaque double glazed window to front. Further under stairs cupboard. Two staircases to the first floor. Three radiators. Doors to..Cloakroom 1 Opaque double glazed window to front. White suite comprising low level WC and wash hand basin with mixer tap. Walls in half tiled surround. Tiled flooring. Built-in cupboard. Radiator. Downlighters.Cloakroom 2 Opaque double glazed window to front. White suite comprising low level WC and wash hand basin with mixer tap. Walls in half tiled surround. Tiled flooring. Radiator. Downlighters.Sitting room20'5" x 14'1" (6.22m x 4.3m). Two large double glazed windows to the rear and double glazed French doors overlooking the gardens. Feature Minster stone open fireplace. Radiator. Four wall light points.Drawing room28'5" (8.66m) x 13'1" (4m) narrowing 9'10" (3m)'.. Large double glazed bay window to the rear. Three large double glazed windows to the side. Polished stone mantled fireplace with cast iron coal effect burner. Two radiators.Dining room20' (6.1m) x 15'7" (4.75m) into bay. Large double glazed bay window to the rear. Large double glazed window to rear. Marble fire surround and hearth with open fireplace. Two radiators.
