listing.description: Description  In association with Fine & CountryBuilt in 1857 by the then vicar of Worton for his own occupation where he stayed for some fifty years, Dysart House is now being sold by only its fourth owner and has been a much loved family home. Set in glorious grounds with mature trees and offering complete privacy, the property offers seven bedrooms, three bathrooms along with three generous reception rooms and a triple garage. Architecturally there is much to be admired, with a variety of brick bonding under a slate roof with various dormer windows, some Bath stone and rendering. There is a wide hallway, generous kitchen and much internal character. Worton is a popular Wiltshire village which can be found about four miles to the south west of Devizes, which caters for most everyday leisure and shopping needs. listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: The Coach House as the name would suggest was the original Coach House to the neighbouring property; converted a number of years ago and extended to form a detached house. The property is constructed of brick under a slate roof sits in a private position with a stunning rural outlook across gardens down to the river Stour and countryside with the Cotswold escarpment beyond. The accommodation offers a flexible arrangement of living with a central hall off which leads the drawing room with a large conservatory, affording the best possible views of the garden and setting. Also off the hall is the fitted kitchen, pantry cupboard, utility and cloakroom. The Dining room off which access is provided to the ground floor bedroom with fitted cupboards and an en-suite bathroom with bath and separate shower. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms looking to the South, a family bathroom, a single bedroom through which you gain access to a further bathroom with a large study beyond, these three rooms would make an excellent master bedroom suite.SituationAlderminster is a charming English village located just four miles south of Stratford-upon-Avon. Set in the countryside, the village has a thriving community and award winning pub/restaurant. Stratford –upon-Avon is renowned as the region’s cultural centre and is the home of the Royal Shakespeare Company. The town has a wide variety of shopping and leisure facilities. There are a great many quality restaurants, public houses and dining pubs with excellent reputations all within walking distance. Warwick and Leamington are also nearby and provide further facilities and schooling. There are state, private and grammar schools in the area to suit most requirements. Stratford-upon-Avon has many opportunities for boating, fishing and rowing, together with a link to the canal network. The town has a racecourse and golf course. The M40, junction 15, is seven miles away and provides access to Birmingham to the North, London to the south and the National Motorway Network.Stratford-upon-Avon – 5 milesBanbury - 18 milesBirmingham International Airport – 31 miles Warwick Parkway Train Station – 14 miles (Trains to London Marylebone 115 mins)(All distances and times are approximate)OutsideThe gravel drive leads to a parking area in front of the property. Immediately to the rear is a extensive paved terrace with the extensive mature gardens which are a particular feature of the property with the lawn running down to a Yew hedge and ha-ha wall beyond which is the River Stour. Adjacent to the lower lawn is a charming open fronted summer house constructed in a boat-house style. Beyond the River Stour is open country with a back drop of the Cotswolds. There are various outbuildings constructed of brick which make ideal garden stores.Additional InformationPostcode – CV37 8NYServices – All mains services are connected to the propertyLocal Authority – Stratford on Avon District Council – Council Tax Band – Band GFixtures and Fittings – Only those items mentioned in the particulars are included in the sale. All other items are specifically excluded but may be available by separate negotiation.Tenure – FreeholdViewing – by appointment with sole agents Hamptons International
listing.short_description: A converted four bedroom coach house in an ideal village location.

listing.description: Ready to change your life? Calling all who are ready to check out of the rat race and want to fulfill their dream of Country living (in Greater London!) This near 15 acre small holding farm will intrigue and impress you in equal measure.Currently a plant nursery with facilities in situ to continue the trade, the property additionally has equestrian facilities (stabling, fields and riding arena) and also comes with several outbuildings which are large enough to store farm machinery. There are some current usage restrictions but the options are still vast. The land contains a handsome residential three bedroom semi-detached cottage with private garden and private entrance which potentially could be extended to a more substantial property (stpp). Lastly, due to its size and positioning, the land has several access points from two hard standing roads which increases usability and access is immediate to the public bridlepath.Local towns include Wallington, Carshalton and Banstead with Croydon and Kingston a little further on in either direction. The M25 is circa 20 minutes drive away, Gatwick Airport 40 minutes away and trains into London and onward further South are available from the local towns. The area is affluent and sought after and offers suburban London living with the hallmarks of Surrey.A rare opportunity which needs to be considered fully before committing to view.Nb. The land and its use does contain covenants and restrictions. Please visit Fine and Country Cheam to view the various documents relating to this property.Nb. The land plan provides an indication of the location and the final plot is to be agreed.Three Bedroom CottageStablesRiding ArenaGrazing FieldsNumerous Out BuildingsSeveral Access PointsMapsImportant note to purchasers:We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller./1

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: This magnificent top floor apartment is situated in the heart of the city a very short distance from the city's mainline railway station with direct links to London. The building is served by a passenger lift with private staircase leading to a reception area from which there is a small room which would be ideally used as a home office/ study if required.The entrance to the apartment opens onto a 'T' shaped hallway with West aspect living room with inset fireplace and above an inset TV, Engineered oak flooring and stunning feature 'window wall' proving access onto the West aspect roof terrace with fabulous views.The bespoke kitchen, by häcker of Germany, comes complete with integrated appliances, granite work surfaces with breakfast bar and doors onto the terrace. The kitchen comprises a mixture of neff and Siemens appliances plus a Bosch washing machine. Adjacent to the kitchen is the dining room, with hallway which leads onto three double bedrooms with the master bedroom and bedroom two both having the benefit of en-suite facilities, bedroom three and separate family bathroom. The master bedroom has built in wardrobes and along with the hallway has a door that leads onto the East facing roof terrace.The apartment benefits from two fabulous roof terraces, the first of which is accessed via the kitchen and living room which is West aspect being decked having built in seating and fabulous views downs Queens Road towards the sea. The second roof terrace being an Easterly and Southerly aspect and with the apartment being in an elevated location has fabulous city scape views also towards the sea. In addition the property comes complete with two secure car parking spaces which are accessible via Fredrick Street.The owners of the property have just completed a major overhaul and is now finished to what is considered to be extremely high specification throughout, and internal inspection is highly advised. Vacant possession no on going chain. The property comes alive at night due to the intelligent use of internal and external lighting.

listing.description: Horton Lodge is a stunning period Riverside home of immense charm and character with many of the original hand carved oak and decorative features synonymous with the Arts & Craft era still visible.The property enjoys spectacular views over Boulters Lock and the River Thames and has the additional benefit of forming part of the Horton Grange development which sits within secureand attractive gated grounds.On entering the property from the front, a delightful reception hall with bespoke porcelain tilled flooring leads to the principle reception rooms. Leading off to the left is a charming dining room which neatly connects both the kitchen breakfast room and sitting room and sees a continuation of the flooring from the entrance hall.The contemporary styled kitchen affords a comprehensive range of storage cupboards complete with granite work surfaces. A full range of integral appliances, such as, a 'Neff' integrated dishwasher, 'Bosch' washing machine, Zanuzzi coffee machine and microwave, Britannia range double oven and wine cooler are all included in the sale price.In recent years Horton Lodge has been lovingly restored and thoughtfully extended by the current owners. This is most apparent in the magnificent sitting room, which has been designed around the dual aspect that this room enjoys. French doors open to provide access to a wrap around terrace with grey limestone paving slabs that neatly blends both indoor and outside space and is great for entertaining or relaxing. A practical cloakroom with utility cupboard completes the ground floor.Upstairs there are three generous bedrooms. Of particular note is the master bedroom suite, which benefits from the second storey of the extension and is complete with a dressing room and a lavish ensuite bathroom. The ensuite is fully tilled with travertine tiles and boasts both a free standing shower and separate roll top bath complete with an inset television. The remaining two bedrooms are serviced by an equally impressive family bathroom.SituationThe River Thames at Boulters Lock is located within 100 yards and offers delightful towpath walks to nearby villages such as Cookham & Bray. Maidenhead town centre lies approximatelytwo miles distant and offers a wide variety of shopping and recreational facilities including an indoor shopping precinct and multi screen cinema.Maidenhead's mainline station provides frequent services to London Paddington and will form part of Crossrail following completion of the works in 2019. The M4 motorway at both Junction 7 and 8/9 gives access to London and the M25 motorway network.OutsideThe house is accessed through wrought iron electrically operated gates leading to the landscaped communal grounds which are well-maintained and lie to the right of the property. In addition Horton Lodge has a private garden nestled behind a mature hedge and a bespoke hand crafted iron fence with remote access.A grey limestone paved terrace encompasses the entire house affording various entertaining and seating areas. A heated Jacuzzi is positioned in a private corner of the plot adjacent to an outsidestore complete with power and light.
listing.short_description: With spectacular views over Boulters Lock and the River Thames, a delightful three bedroom detached period property offering light and spacious accommodation throughout. The property sits within attractive gated grounds with secure parking.

The area is popular due to being surrounded by open countryside yet within easy reach of motorway networks.AccommodationGreat hall - drawing room - dining room - kitchen - breakfast room - garden room - snug - office - 6 bedrooms - 2 bathrooms - snooker roomDog pens - numerous outbuildings - detached garageIn all circa 12.5 acresTimberhonger House is ideally located for commuters with ease access to the M42 and M5 yet the property nestles away in peaceful Worcestershire countryside with numerous local walks and bridle paths. The area is particularly popular with families having children going through the Winterfold and Bromsgrove schooling system, both being highly regarded. There are records of a house from the 16th Century gracing this idyllic rural location.The house is bounded by its own land which comprises in all of some 12.5 acres of pastureland and woodland. The house is of 3 storey brick construction with tiled roofs and is approached along a tree lined driveway meandering through woodland to parking area to the front and a drive that leads to the side of the property to a large amount of parking and garaging to the rear.A short flight of steps leads to a solid oak front door that opens upon to reception lobby with Bideford blue flagged stone floor with a built in Cloaks Cupboard.Cloakroom : A half tiled Shower Room with a matching suite comprising of shower, wash hand basin, W.C. And heated towel rail. The solid oak flooring benefits from Rothaflex underfloor heating.Formal dining room: 27' x 13'10''A lovely room for entertaining with exposed beams to walls and ceiling and a deep window overlooking the gardens giving tremendous natural light.Drawing room: 21'9" x 15'10"A traditionally styled warm and welcoming room with panelled walls, beam ceiling, wide inglenook fireplace with oak panelling and an oak mantel piece, open grate with windows to either side and a large window overlooking the rear courtyard garden.From the Great Hall a door leads in an inner hall with W.C. listing.description: Part exchange considered! Probably the most significant contemporary home to have been built in East Yorkshire in post war years offering extensive family accommodation including an indoor heated swimming pool and separate staff quarters, being set within mature landscaped grounds of around 1.25 acres. Panoramic views are available to the south and east to the River Humber, the Humber Bridge and beyond.Summary:Probably the most significant contemporary home to have been built in East Yorkshire in post war years offering extensive family accommodation including an indoor heated swimming pool and separate staff quarters, being set within mature landscaped grounds of around 1.25 acres. Panoramic views are available to the south and east to the River Humber, the Humber Birdge and beyond.Introduction:This unique property was built in 1963 to an individual design and to the highest specification by the well known local industrialist Mr Harold Needler.In more recent times, the present owners have enlarged, re-arranged and significantly upgraded the property which now provides over 8000 sq ft (743 sq m) of living accommodation, with extensive leisure facilities.Particular features include the indoor heated swimming pool and gymnasium with sauna, changing and shower facilities together with the staff quarters at lower ground floor level. There is substantial covered garaging for four motor cars.The grounds of around 1.25 acres are arranged to give a private walled garden and sweeping lawns with an area allocated for the growing of vegetables and soft fruit. In all, a property of considerable quality and regional importance which can only be appreciated by an internal inspection.Location:Nestling on the south eastern side of a gently sloping site that was specially chosen for its views, this unique home has been specifically designed to take full advantage of the panoramic views of the River Humber and the Lincolnshire Wolds beyond.It was only later that the Humber Bridge was built which now complements this wonderful aspect.Swanland Garth is situated on the western side of Swanland Hill within the northern outskirts of North Ferriby, an exclusive residential village located approximately 7 miles due west of the centre of Kingston Upon Hull.First class road connections are available as the A63 dual carriageway, linking into the M62 motorway, lies nearby with an intersection approximately one mile away, within the southern part of the village.A local train station lies within the village which has good local shopping facilities and an excellent primary school together with a popular public house and an exclusive restaurant.Accommodation:The accommodation is arranged predominantly on a single level for convenient management, although there is self-contained staff accommodation on the lower ground floor. The property is arranged as shown in some detail by the dimensioned floorplan forming part of these particulars of sale, a brief description being as follows.Entrance Hall: - 39' 9'' x 17' 2'' (12.11m x 5.23m)A particular feature being an enclosed atrium containing an ornamental pond stocked with koi carp, the pond being bounded by ornamental and exotic plants.Off the entrance hall there is a cloakroom with separate toilet.Cloakroom: - 7' 2'' x 5' 3'' (2.18m x 1.60m)Having ample hanging space with a doorway leading to a toilet containing a low level w.C. And vanity wash hand basin.Ballroom/Drawing Room: - 34' 8'' max x 20' 6'' min (10.56m x 6.24m)With polished oak ballroom flooring having a vast expanse of glazing to the whole of the south eastern and southern elevations which allow fine views to be gained across the grounds to the River Humber, the Humber Bridge and beyond.A sliding glazed door is discreetly concealed when open allowing the drawing room to interconnect with the sitting room with a further sliding door from the sitting room to the drawing room at the point where it adjoins the indoor swimming pool. There is a glazed wall with sliding door forming the division between the drawing room and swimming pool.The way this part of the property can be opened into a semi plan arrangement makes it ideal for entertaining, there being a discreetly concealed cocktail bar with sink and water supply. A stairway from this reception room leads down to self-contained staff accommodation, a further sliding patio door leads to an enclosed sun room.Sun Room: - 25' 5'' x 14' 11'' max (7.74m x 4.54m)Arranged in an l-shape and designed to give direct access to not only the indoor swimming pool but also to an external terrace via sliding glazed doors with built-in fly screens. Forming part of the sun room there is a granite surfaced serving table and an open fire with Yorkstone surround acts as a central feature.Sitting Room: - 21' 11'' max x 19' 10'' (6.68m x 6.04m)With glazing to the whole of the south eastern elevation with sliding glazed doors. The sitting room has a log effect gas fire set within a marble surround and granite hearth. Dramatic views to the south east are available similar to those gained from the drawing room/ballroom.Study: - 19' 10'' max x 19' 6'' (6.04m x 5.94m)Having extensive glazed sliding doors to the south eastern elevation offering fine views across the river. The study is of an irregular shape having a series of built-in bookshelves and low level cupboards. There is a large marble fireplace with a coal effect gas fire. A doorway from the study leads directly to the entrance hall.Dining Room: - 25' 8'' max x 16' 2'' (7.82m x 4.92m)Direct access to which is gained from the entrance hall. A particular feature of this spacious room is the fixed Lauvicite granite table, the granite being unique to the village of Lauvic in Norway. The table is of a size that comfortably accommodates twelve for dinner. A large glazed panel allows views across the adjoining indoor swimming pool and substantial glazed sliding patio doors give access to a small terrace and a good sized, private walled garden.A doorway from the dining room leads to the indoor pool and a further doorway leads to the kitchen.Kitchen: - 18' 5'' x 15' 9'' (5.61m x 4.80m)Being comprehensively fitted with a range of Rational units in birdseye maple with Coran work surfaces throughout.The kitchen layout is ergonomically designed for maximum convenience and efficiency, differing worktop heights being set to provide ideal working heights for different tasks. Incorporating a full range of units with all work surfaces in Corian, the facilities include a shaped table for casual eating for five people. There is a twin bowl sink and drainer incorporating a waste disposal unit, plus an island unit with a further sink housing the second waste disposal unit. A 90cm linear ceramic hob including an extended plate warming area, with air extractor over, and double oven, all by Gaggenau, are supplemented by a built-in combination microwave and a large built-in Miele refrigerator. A Miele dishwasher is located under the main worktop.There are many more features in this wonderful kitchen which can only be appreciated by a detailed inspection. A large window allows fine views across the private walled garden. A second doorway leads to a separate utility room.Utility Room: - 17' 6'' x 8' 0'' (5.33m x 2.44m)With extractor fan, an extensive range of fitted units incorporating work surface, sink and large full height cupboard and ample space for further appliances. Doorways lead to the side of the property via an outside porch and to the garaging.The bedroom and bathroom facilities make up the eastern wing of the property being arranged as follows:Master Bedroom: - 22' 4'' max x 23' 3'' max (6.80m x 7.08m)Having a deep walk-in glazed bay window which allows extensive views across the grounds towards the River Humber to be gained. A substantial range of fitted wardrobes extend across the whole of one wall and bedside units provide further storage space. A sophisticated light control system to the master bedroom is operated from the bedside units which allow the curtains and the nets to be electrically operated via two separate circuits, the control panel also operating a series of lights to the bedroom and to the adjoining dressing rooms. A long marble display shelf extends across much of one wall and a separate, purpose built shoe cupboard with racking is a most useful feature.Direct access can be gained to two dressing rooms and an en-suite bathroom.Dressing Rooms:There are two dressing rooms, being arranged for both a husband and wife both fitted with an extensive range of fitted wardrobes and drawers, the ladies dressing room having in addition, a built-in dressing table. Direct access can be gained to a large en-suite bathroom.En-suite Bathroom: - 12' 5'' x 11' 4'' (3.78m x 3.45m)Containing a suite comprising a large corner bath, twin vanity wash hand basins, a low level w.C. And bidet together with a large walk-in shower being fully tiled and having twin shower heads and seating.Bedroom 2: - 14' 0'' x 13' 11'' (4.26m x 4.24m)Having extensive glazed windows with fine views to the south. To either side of the bed space there are fitted cupboards and bedside units. Direct access from bedroom 2 can be gained to an interconnecting bathroom with built-in dressing area, the bathroom being shared with bedroom 3.Bathroom: - 8' 10'' x 7' 10'' (2.69m x 2.39m)Containing a suite comprising a panelled bath, vanity wash hand basin and low level w.C.Bedroom 3: - 13' 10'' x 13' 10'' (4.21m x 4.21m)Having an extensive range of fitted wardrobes to two walls, being predominantly glazed to the south elevation from which fine views are available.Bedroom 3 interconnects with the bathroom which also serves bedroom 2, this suite of rooms being arranged at the present time as a large guest suite with bedroom 3 acting as a dressing room/sitting room. Should the original design wish to be returned to, only minor re-arrangement is required.Bedroom 4: - 14' 0'' x 13' 11'' (4.26m x 4.24m)With extensive glazing to the south east giving wonderful views across the grounds towards the River Humber. Direct access from bedroom 4 can be gained to an interconnecting bathroom being of a similar arrangement to bedrooms 2 & 3.Bathroom: - 7' 9'' x 7' 9'' (2.36m x 2.36m)Containing a suite with panelled bath, twin vanity wash hand basins with separate shower head within the work surface in addition to which there is a low level w.C. Off the interconnecting lobby there are a series of fitted wardrobes.Bedroom 5: - 14' 0'' x 14' 0'' (4.26m x 4.26m)With built-in seating and a desk, the south elevation being extensively glazed with fine open views. Direct access from bedroom 5 can be gained via a lobby to the bathroom which interconnects with bedroom 4 as shown in more detail by the dimensioned floorplan forming part of these particulars of sale.The bedroom wing is served by a corridor approximately 53'0" x 5'5" which leads to an inner lobby from which access is gained to a laundry.Laundry: - 11' 4'' x 11' 2'' (3.45m x 3.40m)Being comprehensively fitted with a series of high and low level wall units which incorporate plumbing for an automatic washing machine and venting for a tumble dryer. In addition, there are twin bowled sink units and heated drying cupboards.Leisure Facilities:Swimming Pool: - 47' 0'' x 20' 8'' (14.31m x 6.29m)This extensive indoor heated swimming pool gives a swimming area of 32' in length x 12' in width being one metre deep at the shallow end and two metres deep at the deep end. There are substantial paved surrounds to the pool which adjoins via doorways to the drawing room/ballroom, the sun room, the dining room and the gymnasium. Sliding patio doors lead from the pool area to a terrace within the private walled garden.Gymnasium/Sauna: - 15' 2'' x 14' 11'' (4.62m x 4.54m)With two changing cubicles and single and double showers and toilet. This area extends even further to incorporate an enclosed plant room which houses the self-contained heating system for the pool together with the purification and filtration and dehumidification plant.Off the gymnasium there are two changing rooms and two showers one having a twin head shower system, in addition to which there is a six/eight person sauna, and a separate toilet with low level w.C.Lower Ground Floor:Staff Quarters:A stairway from the drawing room leads down to a lobby with a series of storage cupboards, off which there is a good sized wine cellar.Bedsit/Living Room: - 23' 3'' x 19' 3'' (7.08m x 5.86m)Having a series of fitted wardrobes and low level cupboards. A fully glazed southern wall has patio doors to the lower terrace. Direct access can be gained to a bathroom.Bathroom: - 9' 0'' x 7' 0'' (2.74m x 2.13m)Containing a suite comprising a panelled bath with shower over, vanity wash hand basin and low level w.C. With concealed cistern. Within the bathroom there is a linen cupboard.Garden Store: - 14' 3'' x 9' 6'' (4.34m x 2.89m)A doorway from the living room leads to a garden store which has a doorway leading to a small terrace and the extensive grounds and a further doorway leads to a rear store beyond which access is gained to much of the service area that runs beneath the main property which is both extensive and cavernous.Within this part of the property there is a power point for a generator in the event of a mains power failure and a series of interconnecting water tanks allow the collection of household waste water that could be used for the watering of garden plants and shrubs in the event of a drought when water restrictions are in force.Garaging:Garaging for at least four motor cars is provided within the garage which measures 34'7" x 20'7" access being gained via two panelled doors which are radio controlled via a Hormann remote control system operated from not only within the property but also from approaching vehicles. An electric light and power supply is installed and there is ample room for workshops and benches without limiting the parking of motor cars.Gardens and Grounds:The property is approached across a brick set entrance which leads to a substantial driveway and courtyard with fixed set gravel interspersed with granite sets which provides parking for a significant number of motor cars and leads onward to the front entrance and the garaging.To either side of the drive there are lawned gardens having inset flower borders and shrubs, the gardens extending around the whole of the property.To the south/south east sweeping lawns are bounded for the most part by mature, trimmed conifer hedging which affords considerable privacy and seclusion, the grounds to the rear of the property containing a number of ornamental shrubs, bushes and trees together with a fishpond with stone set surround which makes an attractive feature.There are extensive walkways with paved steps and terraces which lead to further terraced areas with inset flowerbeds beyond which there is an area allocated for the growing of soft fruit and a lower level kitchen garden for the cultivation of vegetables.An aluminium framed greenhouse is discreetly located to the rear of the property and is currently used for the propagation of young plants and vegetables. Within the northern part of the garden there are a number of attractive evergreen and deciduous shrubs, bushes and trees.Outbuildings:Garden Store/Workshop: - 20' 7'' x 7' 9'' (6.27m x 2.36m)Which interconnects in open plan style to a further storage area presently used for housing lawnmowers and other garden equipment. This secondary storage area is accessed by a separate, external up-and-over door allowing convenient storage of larger garden equipment.There is an adjacent gardeners w.C. With wash hand basin.Services & Technical Information:Heating & Ventilation:There is heat recovery ventilation in the kitchen/dining area and the master bedroom/laundry area. This allows 75% of the heat which would be lost with extracted air to be transferred to the fresh incoming air.The heat recovery ventilation system in the swimming pool hall is balanced to provide reduced air pressure to ensure that air movement is from the house into the pool area. The unusual ionising purification system for the pool water is efficient and completely odour-free.Television & Hi-Fi:A television aerial amplifier feeds a signal to the house from the lounge unit so that a video may be watched from any aerial point. The hi-fi wiring interconnects from the lounge to the kitchen, dining room, ballroom, pool hall and downstairs room. The wiring to the hi-fi and television system will remain with the property although loudspeakers and hi-fi units could be made available by separate negotiation.Security:The house has a comprehensive security system connected to the police via a security monitoring service. The lower ground level rooms are on a separate subcircuit enabling this area to be protected at all times even when the rest of the house is in use, the occupants being immediately alerted in the event of any intruder to this area.Personal attack buttons on the security alarm system are located within the hall, bedroom and utility room. A top of the range Chubb security safe is installed which will remain with the property.Central Heating Conditioning:Waste heat from the air conditioning in the lounge/lower ground floor and the ballroom is used to heat the swimming pool. It is normal for the gas air heating for the pool not to be required between May and September in any year.The central heating is designed as five separate units so that if a fault arises only a small part of the complete heating system is out of action.Electricity Supply:There is a mains electric supply to the property which is wired to provide a separate power supply to the freezers so that in the event of a failure of the main circuit, the freezer supply is not interfered with. It should also be noted that there is a separate point for the connection of a generator in the event of a complete external power supply failure, as mentioned earlier within this brochure.External Electrical Information:Outside power points are provided to the front garden fountain, plus a spare socket, to the front near the main front door and to the front at the side of the garage with multiple points near the lower garden pond controlled by switches in the ballroom.The walled garden light is switched from the dining room and the front garden floodlight is controlled by a light sensor with front garden "lamp posts" controlled by a time switch. Other external lights are controlled by various appropriate switches.Services:All mains services are connected to the property.Heating:The property has a series of interconnected yet separate gas fired central heating boilers.Insulation:The property is double glazed.Tenure:The property is freehold and vacant possession will be gained upon completion.Security:A sophisticated security alarm system is installed as described in more detail above.Council Tax:Council Tax is payable to the East Riding of Yorkshire Council. From verbal enquiries we are advised that the property is shown in the Council Tax Property Bandings List in Valuation Band H.*Fixtures & Fittings:Certain fixtures and fittings may be purchased with the property but may be subject to separate negotiation as to price.Disclaimer:*The agent has not had sight of confirmation documents and therefore the buyer is advised to obtain verification from their solicitor or surveyor.Viewing:Strictly by appointment with the sole agents.Mortgages:We will be pleased to offer independent advice regarding a mortgage for this property, details of which are available from our Fine and Country Office on . Independent advice will be given by Licensed Credit Brokers. Written quotations on request. Your home is at risk if you do not keep up repayments on a mortgage or other loan secured on it.Valuation/Market Appraisal:Thinking of selling or struggling to sell your house? More people choose beercocks in this region than any other agent. Book your free valuation now!

listing.description: Unique, stunning Farm house set in 11 acres of land. This beautiful property offers unbelievably spacious and versatile living accommodation and has the advantage of separate outbuildings - Three 10ft x 10ft stable blocks, 30ft x 15ft workshop, 1 acre paddock, 1 acre pond, sheep wintering quarters, shippon. Set in 11 acres with panoramic views, this detached farmhouse simply must be viewed to fully appreciate its size, quality of the amenities available and its layout. This outstanding home comprises: A grand entrance porch, formal dining room, lounge, sitting room, dining kitchen and utility room. To the first floor, three double bedrooms, master with en-suite and a family bathroom with jacuzzi bath. Externally, private gated driveway in a secluded area, ample parking with large parking areas, garage and car port. This character filled property also benefits from solar panels, stunning open views over looking local countryside. Viewing by appointment only, you will not be disappointed!EPC Grade = DEntrance PorchDouble glazed windows, feature picture stained glass window, exposed timber beams, porcelain tiled flooring, radiator, ceiling light/fan point, feature multi colour down lights.Lounge (5.13m x 6.76m)Double glazed windows to front and rear aspect, french doors providing access to rear garden, fire place with feature surround, radiator, ceiling light point, bespoke solid wood staircase leading to 1st floor.Dining Room (4.52m x 7.82m)Double glazed windows to the side and front aspect, exposed timber beams, fire place with feature surround, door providing access to porch.Snug (3.96m x 5.69m)Open fire place, radiator, ceiling light point, french doors to side aspect, television point, coving, double glazed windows to rear aspect.Utility RoomDoor to rear gardens, boiler wall mounted, double glazed window to rear aspect.Kitchen / Breakfast Room (2.69m x 5.51m)Matching wall and base units with complimentary work surfaces, splash tiling, oven, five ring hob, chimney extractor, tiled flooring, double glazed windows to front and rear aspect, radiator, ceiling light point, stable door providing access to rear gardens.LandingStorage cupboard, radiator, ceiling light point, loft hatch, double glazed window to rear aspect with outstanding views across open fields.Master Bedroom (4.5m x 4.7m)Double glazed windows to front and rear aspect with magnificent views over open fields, built-in furniture, radiator, ceiling light point. Door leading to en-suite shower room.En-Suite Shower RoomDouble glazed window to front aspect, tiled floor and walls, shower/wet room, wash hand basin, low level WC, heated towel rail, ceiling light point.Bedroom (4.80m x 4.98m)Double glazed window to front and rear aspect, fitted bedroom furniture suite, radiator, ceiling light point.Bedroom (2nd) (3.61m x 3.94m)Double glazed window to rear aspect, radiator, ceiling light point.Family BathroomLarge Jacuzzi bath with shower over, low level WC, wash hand basin, tiled walls and floor, radiator, ceiling light point.ExternalApproached by a private driveway which leads to this magnificent farm house set in 11 acre plot. Outbuildings - Three 10ft x 10ft stable blocks, 30ft x 15ft workshop, 1 acre paddock, 1 acre pond, sheep wintering quarters, shippon.Important note to purchasers:We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller./8

listing.description: What an incredible find here in Effingham, this chalet detached family home really needs to be viewed to take in all its glory. Are you looking for a family property with fantastic space in and out? You have the freedom here to really make this into your family's dream property.From the outset you have so much space here for you and the family and visiting friends with parking and a further single garage too. Having plans passed already to square the downstairs off, you really will be excited with the potential here. The flexible living throughout along with the incredible size rooms, your guests will really be totally wowed. Why not let the lucky guests stay over in one of the five double bedrooms before you surprise them to a good old cooked breakfast in the mornings before those days at the office?The outside space is breath-taking along with a piggery ready to be developed and the benefit of a rented field, this is just simply stunning and oozing with potential. No words can explain what this delight is all about. Location, schooling, fantastic walks, golf courses and much, much more. Please do not take my word for it and we look forward to seeing you on the viewing.What the Owner says:We have all loved being here and making this our own, but more importantly we have enjoyed having the fantastic large garden, as well as the great location to The Howard of Effingham School; these factors really made our home work for the family. Now we feel it is time to make another move, but are leaving with the potential for the new owners to really turn this property into their dream home. listing.description: A mixed commercial and residential investment property (business unaffected). There is a corner shop front with substantial office space and workshop to the rear and also includes an integral one and a half size garage. The first floor currently comprises three apartments, two of which are two bedrooms and an additional studio flat. These are all currently let. The premises would suit someone wishing to occupy the ground floor premises, as the shop occupies an excellent trading position. There is additional potential (stpp) to enlarge the residential space and/or apply for change of use.Situated in a convenient location bordering East/West Molesey. Close to local shops and within easy access of schools, library, health and fitness clubs. Hampton Court Station (tfl zone 6) and Bridge Road with its bustling cafés, restaurants, boutiques and antique shops is only a short distance away. There is also a regular bus service, connecting with Kingston and Walton upon Thames.

listing.description: The moment you arrive at this property, you will begin to sense the special qualities the house has to offer. Every aspect of this immaculately presented home will not fail to impress.A sweeping driveway meanders its way to the house. A beautiful, individually designed home with stunning grounds and amazing views. Seldom will you find a house that offers everything you would want and more.This property is one of a kind, which will inspire and draw breath. The wow factor is everywhere!If space is your requirement, then yet again this home will not fail to satisfy. This substantial property offers over 3000sq ft of habitable living space. A magnificent property which has been cleverly designed and gives an abundance of natural light. The property is situated within its own grounds within a semi-rural setting - a beautiful haven to be enjoyed with all the family.Hadlow Village includes a local butcher, greengrocer, post office, pharmacy, and village store, together with a medical centre, schools and a college.What the Owner says:We purchased this property in 2008 at auction. The house was a shell and needed substantial amounts of work. Despite this, we saw the potential of the property and began to re-design the interior to create the home we have today.The modern spacious accommodation satisfies the needs of our entire family. The semi-rural location is convenient yet conveys a "country living" feel. There are wonderful views and a secluded atmosphere is present within the grounds. The inside and outside areas are a perfect place to entertain family and friends.This property is a truly impressive home which we have had the pleasure of owning for the past 8 years.Room sizes:Reception Hall 16'7 x 10'10 (5.06m x 3.30m)Drawing Room 16'3 x 12'7 (4.96m x 3.84m)Downstairs CloakroomFamily/Dining Room 22'4 x 15'7 (6.81m x 4.75m)Kitchen 15'7 x 10'8 (4.75m x 3.25m)Games Room/Reception 2 20'4 x 18'6 (6.20m x 5.64m)Landing/Sitting AreaMaster Suite 19'7 x 15'7 (5.97m x 4.75m)Dressing AreaEn-suite bathroomBalcony 18'6 x 5'4 (5.64m x 1.63m)Guest Suite 16'3 x 12'7 (4.96m x 3.84m)En-suite bathroomFamily BathroomBedroom 3 13'0 x 12'5 (3.97m x 3.79m)Bedroom 4 12'4 x 9'4 (3.76m x 2.85m)Beamlock Double GarageSet within one acreIn and out drivewayLarge Rear GardenThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

listing.description: AbbotFox Bespoke presents a unique opportunity to purchase this central Norwich car park located adjacent to the Roman Catholic Cathedral on Earlham Road. With spaces for approximately sixty vehicles the site offers a unique opportunity for parking revenue or further development subject to the relevant planning permissions being granted.The Golden Triangle has been one of the most popular residential areas in the city of Norwich since the 1980s, when it was dubbed as the ‘Notting Hill’ of Norwich. The area contains a cosmopolitan mix of professionals, students and families, whilst the area is characterised by its terraced housing, pubs and parks. The bulk of the housing in the area was built during the Victorian era and the Golden Triangle is generally coined as one of the more affluent parts of Norwich. With the city centre only a 5 minute walk away, the area boasts ease of access to the popular shopping facilities of Norwich, whilst the uea, Hospital and Science Park are within an equally close reach of the property.

listing.description: One of Horning's most iconic riverside residences, resplendent following an exhaustive programme of renovations that have succeeded in retaining the character and charm of the original, now complemented by the very highest quality contemporary finish.A labour of love for the current owners, the comprehensive list of works completed includes a generous ground floor extension, completely reroofed, rewired and re-plumbed with a new boiler and under floor heating. New windows and doors throughout, re-rendered and repainted, and hard-wired smoke detectors throughout the house. The interior has been reorganised and redecorated with an impressive new staircase and galleried landing, a beautifully fitted kitchen/breakfast room finished in ivory and black granite with a comprehensive range of built in appliances, and immaculately presented bathrooms and shower rooms.The generous accommodation now comprises a spacious reception hall with a semi open plan arrangement leading to the dining room and beyond to the kitchen/breakfast room, both of which offer impressive views out over the river. The ground floor continues with a dual aspect living room with a beautiful stone fireplace and leads out onto the River Bure. There is also a study, utility room and cloakroom.On the first floor is the impressive master suite with river facing, dual aspect bedroom, dressing room and generous four-piece wet room style en-suite bathroom. Bedroom 2 also has en-suite facilities with a split level family bathroom serving the two remaining double bedrooms.The south west facing rear garden offers stunning panoramic river views leading out towards Horning Sailing Club, with approximately 50ft of quay headed frontage onto the River Bure with a 26ft long mooring dock.Steeped in local history and associated for many years with the Percival family who ran a prominent boatyard in the village between the 1920s and the 1940s, and whose son Tom was recognised during the 1970s and early 1980s as one of the world's top powerboat drivers, crowned F1 World Champion in 1978 before tragically losing his life as a result of an accident during the Belgium Grand Prix of 1984.Set at the very heart of Horning with the village's comprehensive range of amenities within easy walking distance and the entire Norfolk Broads network literally on its doorstep, this beautifully restored Broads residence is offered for sale with no onward chain. Viewing is strongly recommended.AccommodationEntrance HallSpacious reception area with an impressive sweeping staircase leading up to a galleried landing. Moulded cornice, down lighters with dimmer controls, feature arch window to front aspect, Karndean flooring, under stair storage cupboard. Archway to dining room, glazed double door to living room.CloakroomTravertine tiled floor and walls, low level w/c, vanity hand basin, extractor fan, circular window to side aspect, down lighters, panelled door.Living Room: 28'0" (32'4" max) x 16'0" (20'10" max)Impressive dual aspect reception room. Steps leading down from the entrance hall, sash windows to side and rear with French doors leading out onto the river facing terrace offering beautiful views. Feature limestone fireplace, down lighters and wall lights, all with dimmer controls, moulded cornices, multiple TV and telephone points.Dining Room: 16'6" x 13'1"Arched French doors leading out onto the river facing terrace offering elevated views of the river. Moulded cornices, down lighters with dimmer controls, Karndean flooring, TV and telephone points.Study: 13'1" x 9'0"Sash window to front aspect. Moulded cornices, down lighters with dimmer controls, TV and telephone points, panelled door.Kitchen/Breakfast Room: 29'2" x 12'1"Extensive range of fitted wall and floor mounted units finished in ivory with black granite worktops. Double Butler sink with an additional sink unit set within the large island unit, fitted Siemens appliances include a double oven, induction five ring hob, extractor hood, larder style fridge with matching freezer and two fitted wine coolers.Travertine tiled floor down lighters with dimmer controls, moulded corners. Triple aspect with sash window to side, feature arch window to rear and French doors leading out onto the terrace looking out over the river.Utility Room: 12'8" x 4'7"Sink unit and drainer with range of fitted units finished in ivory and black granite. Bosch washing machine and tumble dryer, tiled floor, moulded cornices, down lighters, sash window to rear, extractor fan, panelled door, fire door to garage.First floorGalleried LandingArch window to front aspect, circular window to side, moulded cornices, wall lights, dimmer controls, radiators.Master Bedroom Suite: Master Bedroom: 20'10" max x 12'2" max (not square)Dual aspect with panoramic views out over the river and down to Horning Sailing Club, down lighters and wall lights with dimmer controls, moulded cornices, three radiators, TV and telephone points, panelled doors.Dressing Room: 11'7" x 6'3" (10'4" max)Sash window to rear with river views, down lighters with dimmer controls, moulded cornices, panelled doors.En-Suite Bathroom: 11'6" x 8'6"Beautifully finished with Travertine tiled walls and floor, wet room with dual shower heads. Inset panelled bath finished in granite with waterfall tap, low level w/c, vanity wash basin mirror with motion controlled light, shaver points, extractor fan, heated towel rail, down lighters, sash window to side.Bedroom 2: 14'7 x 13'0"Feature arch window to front aspect, radiator, down lighters and dimmer controls, TV and telephone points, panelled door.En-Suite Shower RoomWet room with dual shower heads, vanity wash basin, low level w/c, motion activated mirror/light, shaver points, sash window to front, heated towel rail, panelled door, down lighters.Bedroom 3: 20'5" x 12'1"Sash window to rear, TV and telephone points, down lighters with dimmer controls, panelled door. Radiators.Bedroom 4: 10'6" x 8'11"Sash window to rear, radiator, down lighters with dimmer controls, TV and telephone points, built in cupboard housing hot water tank. Cat/media system installed.BathroomSplit level tiled floor with two vanity wash basins, both with motion controlled mirrors and shaver points, low level w/c, steps up to an inset bath with shower over, two heated towel rails, extractor fan, down lighters, sash window to front aspect, panelled door.OutsideThe property is approached via a newly laid tarmac driveway which leads to a generous Integral Garage: 23'4" x 12'7" with remote controlled roller door, power and light, window and door to side and built in boiler cupboard.Secure gated access to both sides leading to the rear garden, which is dominated by the stunning panoramic views out over the River Bure, with approximately 50ft of private quay heading including a mooring dock measuring 26'0" x 8'3". Two water points and double electric points in the garden, and LED dimmable garden lighting. There is a complete self-draining system on the patio area and front drive.The garden is set mainly to lawn with mature shrubs and flowering borders. Steps lead up to the walled terrace which extends across the full rear of the property providing the perfect vantage point to appreciate the beautiful and picturesque setting.Additional informationTenure: FreeholdExtensive programme of renovations completed in 2016.Services: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage.Available with no onward chain.Whilst it is our intention that these sales particulars offer a fair and accurate account, they are provided for guidance purposes only and do not constitute part of any offer or contract.All measurements are approximate and we have not tested any equipment or services, and no warranty is given or implied that these are in working order.Prospective purchasers are advised to satisfy themselves by inspection or by further investigation via their solicitor or surveyor.
listing.short_description: No onward chain. A beautifully restored Broads residence, set in the heart of Horning, with a south west facing rear garden offering panoramic river views, 50ft of quay headed river frontage and a 26ft long mooring dock.

listing.description: London Square Spitalfields Coming Soon.This two bedroom apartment at London Square Spitalfields forms part of an exclusive collection of one, two and three bedroom apartments situated just a short walk from Brick Lane, Shoreditch and the markets of Spitalfields and LeadenhallLondon Square Spitalfields is the latest development from award-winning developer London Square. Each apartment has been designed to a high specification focusing on maximising light to create spacious living areas.With a fantastic central location, the development is a short walk from Aldgate station, offering a variety of transport options to explore the city and beyond.This modern oasis is situated in the perfect location giving you the best of both worlds: Within close proximity to independent shops, restaurants and bars, yet close to an eclectic mix of markets, art galleries that Brick Land and Shoreditch has to offer.Register your interest now to receive your exclusive invitation to the launch.DevelopmentA stylish collection of one, two and three bedroom apartments set around the beautiful landscaped grounds of Mallon Gardens and Grade II listed Toynbee Hall.Intelligently designed and well appointed, each apartment is finished to the highest specification. Inside space is bright and airy with large family/entertainment and relaxation space with doors leading to a terrace or balcony.Well-appointed master bedrooms feature built-in wardrobes and ensuite bathroom. Apartments also benefit from concierge service and bicycle storage.Perfectly situated on Commercial Street, where the City meets the vibrant East End, London Square Spitalfields is just a short walk from Brick Lane, Shoreditch and the markets of Spitalfields and Leadenhall. Transport links include tube, road, rail and riverboat.Culture & LeisureSet in the heart of London, the area is noted for its intimate streets, historic architecture, modernist structures; and for being the point where the historic City merges with the vibrant East End.Explore the eclectic mix of art and culture, galleries, retailers and buzzing restaurants of Brick Lane and Shoreditch. Or visit Spitalfields market, browse the luxurious stores of Leadenhall or sample the trend setting flavours of Borough Market.Art, culture and creativity give the area its energy, with world renowned galleries, new talent and the latest in public and street art on display. The worlds most visited modern art gallery, Tate Modern, is just upriver with the National Gallery beyond and White Cube to the South.For a day, or night, out, the West End with its theatres, clubs, bars and restaurants - or the bright lights of Regent Street, Oxford Street and Mayfair - are all just a short tube ride away.Fashion & RetailA treasure trove of the hippest shops, stores and pop ups can be found in the area, from vintage to high-end designer in boutiques such as Mercantile, Oscar Milo and Collectif Clothing.Old Spitalfields Market shows off beautiful designer dresses, antique gems and avant-garde creations whilst also playing host to household names including AllSaints, Ted Baker, mac Cosmetics, Hackett and Office.The grand Piazza of Covent Garden is just a quick taxi ride way with stores from Barbour to Burberry, Chanel to Charlotte Tilbury. High-end brands can be found on Bond Street with nearby Burlington Arcade focused on fine jewellery, watches, fragrances and luxury goods.For a full day out, Westfield, home to more than 300 stores, is just a short journey away.Health & WellbeingParks and open spaces abound including Victoria Park and Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park whilst St Katharine Docks provides the perfect spot to start a walk or cycle along the banks of The Thames.A superb choice of health clubs, including Spitalfields Tower Aldgate, 1Rebel, Devonshire Square, Virgin Active Tower Bridge, London Aldgate and David Lloyd Studio, are all within an easy walking distance.EducationLocal campuses and fast transport links means that London's most prestigious universities and colleges are in easy reach.Off City Road can be found University of London with Central St Martins, whose alumni includes Stella McCartney and John Galliano, is now based at Granary Square in King's Cross. To the West is London School of Economics, King's College London and Imperial College while just north of Soho are the quadrangles of University College London.Local primary schools include Harry Gosling Primary School and Canon Barnett Primary School making this a good location for a young family.TransportLondon Square Spitalfields is just three minutes walk from Aldgate East tube station and 12 minutes from Liverpool Street; providing fast access to the West End with the transport hubs of Victoria, Waterloo and Paddington less than 20 minutes away.London City Airport is also less than 20 minutes while the terminals of Heathrow and Gatwick are only a short journey away. For an alternative commute the River Bus at Tower Millennium Pier goes to London Bridge City Pier in just four minutes and Canary Wharf Pier in nine minutes.Crossrail's Elizabeth Line, opening in late 2018 will provide direct connections to Paddington, Heathrow and beyond from Liverpool Street.Details are correct at time of going to press, October 2016.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A delightful detached Grade II listed family house with a unique and versatile layout which has been refurbished and modernised in many areas whilst retaining some fine period features such as exposed beams and fireplaces. Offered in good order throughout and with no onward chain, points of particular note include the following: A well fitted and equipped kitchen/breakfast room with outlooks of the garden and beyond, a range of wall and base units, a larder cupboard, long work surfaces, an oil fired aga which also provides hot water and ample space for a table and chairs. An adjacent dining room with large Jerusalem stone tiled flooring and opens into a delightful wooden constructed conservatory with windows all around and French doors opening onto the garden and a glimpse of Bewl Water. An elegant sitting room with exposed beams and a large inglenook fireplace with wood burning stove which leads into a snug/family room with wooden flooring and feature fireplace with marble surround. To the first floor there are four bedrooms. The principal bedroom has a feature brick surround fireplace and a well fitted en suite shower room and all bedrooms enjoy lovely rural outlooks. The guest bedroom has fantastic views of the garden and surround. To the top floor is a further bedroom which has an en suite shower room and a range of fitted cupboards.SituationThe house sits on elevated ground within the High Weald; an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and on the eastern edge of Bewl Water reservoir – the largest inland area of water in the South East. The picturesque villages of Ticehurst, Lamberhurst and Wadhurst are about 2 miles, 3.5 miles and 5 miles respectively for local shopping and the popular spa town of Tunbridge Wells lies about 10 miles to the north-west for more comprehensive shopping. The area is very well served for schools for both boys and girls of all ages and there is superb outriding all around the reservoir and at nearby Bedgebury Forest.OutsideThe property is approached via a 5 bar wooden gate onto a gravel driveway which provides parking and a garage with additional storage adjacent and above. The garden is well established and mainly laid to lawn. In all about 0.6 acres.Additional InformationTrain Services: Wadhurst Station, about 6.5 miles, Frant Station, about 9 miles and Tonbridge Station, about 17 miles all offering fast trains to London. Road Connections: The location is superb for the A21 and M25 motorway. Nearby Golf Clubs: Dale Hill and Lamberhurst.
listing.short_description: Situated along a rural lane close to Bewl Water, this delightful detached Grade II Listed family house has a unique and versatile layout having been modernised in many areas whilst retaining some fine period features all set within established gardens of about 0.6 acres.
